title-group.article-title: Cubature Formulas for Symmetric Measures in Higher Dimensions with Few Points

abstract.p: We study cubature formulas for d-dimensional integrals with an arbitrary symmetric weight function of product form. We present a construction that yields a high polynomial exactness: for fixed degree l = 5 or l = 7 and large dimension d the number of knots is only slightly larger than the lower bound of Moller and much smaller compared to the known constructions. We also show, for any odd degree l = 2k + 1, that the minimal number of points is almost independent of the weight function. This is also true for the integration over the (Euclidean) sphere.
